extendedIngredients.name: baby greens
extendedIngredients.original: Handful of spicy baby greens, such as mizuna, for garnish
extendedIngredients.originalName: spicy baby greens, such as mizuna, for garnish

extendedIngredients.name: beets
extendedIngredients.original: 8 small beets (about 2 1/2 pounds), washed and trimmed

extendedIngredients.name: feta cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 4 ounces feta cheese, thinly sliced (see Note)

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, cut into small bits
extendedIngredients.originalName: unsalted butter, cut into small bits

title: Roasted Chioggia Beets with Feta
summary: Roasted Chioggia Beets with Fetan is a gluten free and vegetarian side dish. This recipe serves 8. For $1.46 per serving, this recipe covers 9% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains about 4g of protein, 11g of fat, and a total of 201 calories. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. Head to the store and pick up shallot, grapeseed oil, feta cheese, and a few other things to make it today. With a spoonacular score of 30%, this dish is rather bad. Try Roasted Chioggia Beets With Nectarine Juices & Marjoram, Chioggia Beets with Raspberry Mint Vinaigrette, and Chioggia Beet Borani with Fetan and Toasted Sesame Seeds for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350. In a medium bowl, whisk together 1/4 cup of the raspberry vinegar, 1 1/2 tablespoons of the honey, the shallot, 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper. Whisk in the grapeseed oil until emulsified.                                               Arrange the beets so they fit snugly in a single layer in a deep baking dish. Add enough water to barely cover the beets, then add the remaining 1/4 cup of vinegar and 1 1/2 tablespoons of honey and the butter. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with foil and bake for 50 to 60 minutes, or until the beets are tender when pierced with a knife. Let cool slightly.                                              Drain and peel the beets and slice them 1/4 inch thick. Add them to the honey dressing and let cool for up to 4 hours.                                              To serve, arrange half of the beet slices on 8 small plates and cover with the feta. Top with the remaining beet slices and drizzle each serving with about 1 tablespoon of the dressing. Garnish with the greens and serve.

steps.step: In a medium bowl, whisk together 1/4 cup of the raspberry vinegar, 1 1/2 tablespoons of the honey, the shallot, 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper.
Whisk in the grapeseed oil until emulsified.
Arrange the beets so they fit snugly in a single layer in a deep baking dish.

Add enough water to barely cover the beets, then add the remaining 1/4 cup of vinegar and 1 1/2 tablespoons of honey and the butter. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with foil and bake for 50 to 60 minutes, or until the beets are tender when pierced with a knife.
Drain and peel the beets and slice them 1/4 inch thick.
Add them to the honey dressing and let cool for up to 4 hours.
To serve, arrange half of the beet slices on 8 small plates and cover with the feta. Top with the remaining beet slices and drizzle each serving with about 1 tablespoon of the dressing.
Garnish with the greens and serve.
